sentences.sContent: Some species weave designs into their webs, creating zigzag patterns that can either attract prey, like bees, in bright sunlight, or camouflage the net in the shade.
sentences.sContent_eng: Some species weave designs into their webs, creating zigzag patterns that can either attract prey, like bees, in bright sunlight, or camouflage the net in the shade.
sentences.sCn: 一些种类的蜘蛛能设计织网，设计出可以在明媚的阳光下吸引猎物，如蜜蜂，或在阴暗处能掩饰蜘蛛网的之字形图案。

sentences.sContent: Located at 4210 Silver Hill Road just outside of Washington, D.C., the museum is a massive zigzag-shaped edifice constructed of five interconnected pods—each pod larger than a football field.
sentences.sContent_eng: Located at 4210 Silver Hill Road just outside of Washington, D.C., the museum is a massive zigzag-shaped edifice constructed of five interconnected pods—each pod larger than a football field.
sentences.sCn: 这座博物馆位于华盛顿特区郊外的银山路4210号，建得宏伟壮观，五个相互连通的分区组成之字形，每个分区的面积比足球场还大。

synos.tran: 曲折的；锯齿形的；之字形的
曲折行进；作之字形行进
曲折地；之字形地；Z字形地

trans.tranCn: 曲折的；锯齿形的；之字形的
使成之字形；使曲折行进
trans.tranOther: to move forward in sharp angles, first to the left and then to the right etc
a pattern that looks like a line of z’s joined together

trans.tranCn: 曲折地；之字形地；Z字形地
trans.tranOther: to move forward in sharp angles, first to the left and then to the right etc
